title: paxmao
author: paxmao
content: This is just the basics, but anyone should be aware of it:Budget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Have a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Avoid drugs / drink as much as possible, they will make you loose some control innevitably.Seek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.Anything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMBudget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Also that the budget on gambling weekly should not be higher than 2 to 5% of the gambler weekly income. Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMHave a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Gambling should be for fun. It should not be what someone should consider to give a break for, but to be done at a very short period of time weekly. Gamblers should not chase losses too

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMThis is just the basics, but anyone should be aware of it:Budget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Have a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Avoid drugs / drink as much as possible, they will make you loose some control innevitably.Seek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.Anything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling? Set the limit to the budget. I reckon people should have a budget set for entertainment or money set for expenses you'd use to spend for yourself, take a small amount from that instead of separating it. It might also be useful to read self-exclusion terms in a casino, maybe try to put it in a easy to access button like bookmarks (or anything if you have something easier and faster). Lastly, don't be dumb enough to chase for wins/losses. Just take what you can get imo. It's not a job, sure you can feel frustrated if you lose but limit it to that.

comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMThis is just the basics, but anyone should be aware of it:Budget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Have a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Avoid drugs / drink as much as possible, they will make you loose some control innevitably.Seek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.Anything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling? I totally agree with the part of pre-planning a budget before you start your gambling. That is a very responsible way to save yourself from losing all your money. Also, perhaps inviting a friend to hold your budget for you and ask him to not give you any of your money in the case that you should feel like you are starting to lose control. That might also be a smart precaution to take? Avoiding alcohol intake during gambling might take the fun out of gambling for some people. Its basically part of the entire gambling experience, is it not? Unless of course you have had a drinking problem in the past. If you had an addiction problem In that case it would be better to stay away anything which can be considered addictive. Gambling included.

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMHave a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider. Engaging in gambling activities is not mentally exhausting. In fact, during my afternoon breaks or after finishing my daily activities, I often find myself playing games of chance or monitoring soccer games. It's a fun pastime, as long as you don't feel sad when you lose small amounts of money that you've deposited.Gambling can be a fun and entertaining activity, but it's important to remember not to let it negatively impact our financial stability. It's crucial to only gamble with money that we can afford to lose, and to never let it interfere with our financial responsibilities.Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMSeek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone. Playing other games on Steam can be a viable alternative when your girlfriend or friends are unavailable.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: While I agree with all of it, I must say that having some drinks while doing almost anything just makes things better, specially with friends. It enhances the experience, but makes it very easy to spend more than one has planned in the budget. So one of my recommendations would be to only take the money of the budget to the casino if one plans to drink alcohol or accept drinks provided by the house, so in case one lose some control over the decision making capabilities, still there will be no money to gamble beyond the budget. Leave credit cards and jewelry at home.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMBudget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.<...>Anything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling? In general this is good advice, but when someone gets out of control with gambling it is their emotional side that takes over and then all rational plans go to shit, like the one in the budget. If you go into tilt, if you start to chase your losses, it doesn't matter what budget plan you have made.Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMSeek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.That usually happens after the gambling binge, after you have lost too much, but it's good advice too. When someone cannot control their problematic gambling habit, help should be sought.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMThis is just the basics, but anyone should be aware of it:Budget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Have a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Avoid drugs / drink as much as possible, they will make you loose some control innevitably.Seek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.Anything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling? I think people know right from wrong enough to know when they’re doing bad behavior. I believe it is greed that pushes people to bet amounts they know they shouldn’t and extend losing streaks. If you know you’re the kind of person that does this sort of behavior, be conscious of it and don’t put lots of money in places where you’re able to easily gamble it.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMThis is just the basics, but anyone should be aware of it:Budget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.This is absolutely good advice that I have read for a long time now. Some gamblers are just bent on gambling so hard, making sure they win something before they stop, and some times they may not win anything, so they keep going. Even if they end up winning, they might have gambled off a lot of money and might not even win up to half of what they have lost. It's very necessary to make a budget and specify the amount that the person will gamble off, so that once they exhaust the money, they can stop gambling without minding if they won or not.I don't know how others feel, but I think gambling is intuitive. Without those budgets, a gambler might not even realize it until they have gambled off a lot of money.There are these street bets that I usually see people doing in my country. Some young guys on the street who gamble sometimes end up gambling with their phones; they can even go to the extent of gambling with anything they have on their body, which includes their clothes, trousers, shoes, or jewelry. This is no joke; one day a guy has to walk away from the street bet with only his boxers, which means he has gambled with everything he had on him.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMBudget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.Have a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.Very very important, Like for me I don't use percentage... Like how some other gamblers use like 3 or 4 percent of their income, if my total monthly income is 10,000 and I allocate 4 percent of it to gambling it would amount to 400 dollars which I pretty huge, IMO.What I normally do is that I just take a fixed amount like 50 Dollars and spend it on gambling and as soon as that money get exhausted I quit for that month.QuoteAnything else anyone can think of? Like... read this post before gambling? If I should add anything to this list it would be, "be time conscious" although allocating money also plays a role here but aside that you should set a time limit for yourself, because most times when we're on the winning spree there's this urge for us to continue playing and also when we're losing there's also the urge for us to start chasing losses.Just put a time limit and once your time is up just log out of your casino and focus on other part of your life that needs attention.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMBudget: set it BEFORE you start gambling and stick to it.The bolded part seems to be the main problem for most gamblers. Setting up a budget before gambling is easy and most gamblers do it as well but most of the time gamblers fail to stick on their own limit. Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMHave a break from time to time, it is important to let your brain stop and consider.I would say that it is better if we set our own gambling activity like once/twice a week or once/twice a month and for sure the above budget limit should also be applied. Combination between wise time and money management will be the best thing to do imo. Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMAvoid drugs / drink as much as possible, they will make you loose some control innevitably.Drink is fine as long as it is not too much, as long as we are still able to control ourselves then it is fine to drink (alcohol) while gambling. Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMSeek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.Once a gambler is addicted, he/she does not realize that he/she is going too far. It would be better if we can avoid it from the beginning by asking help from someone we trust such as wife, girlfriend, or maybe brother/sister so they can always give a warning to us anytime we start our gambling.

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Quote from: paxmao on May 11, 2023, 11:03:57 PMSeek help if you feel you are no longer in control. Make a phone call to a friend or go out and speak with someone.This is the hardest part. I was addicted in the past, but I fixed the problem myself. It's very embarrassing to ask for help from friends. I don't want them to judge me, and I'm just not the type of person who is open enough to share my personal problems. I think the best way to avoid getting addicted is to prevent it altogether. You know, they say 'prevention is better than cure.
